docs.snippet: After a series of horrifying injuries to pitchers, most recently to J. A. Happ of the Blue Jays, baseball is considering ways to better protect those on the mound from sizzling line drives....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a series of horrifying injuries to pitchers, most recently to J. A. Happ of the Blue Jays, baseball is considering ways to better protect those on the mound from sizzling line drives.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that after a series of horrifying injuries to pitchers, most recently to J A Happ of the Toronto Blue Jays, baseball is considering ways to better protect those on the mound from sizzling line drives.

headline.seo: On the Mound, 60 Feet 6 Inches From Disaster

byline.contributor: Jorge Arangure Jr. contributed reporting from New York, and David Waldstein from Denver.
